dashboard.label: Settings
dashboard.description: How to use settings to customize the visualization.

td.p: Slides to ShowThe number of slides to show at the same time.

Scroll at a TimeThe number of slides to scroll each time the scroll is triggered. This can't be more than the total number of slides. If you make it more that the 'Slides to Show' then some slides will be skipped.
AutoplaySet to true if you want the slides to scroll. False will mean only the first 'Slides to Show' slides will be visible, all others will be hidden.
Autoplay SpeedHow fast to scroll the slides. The options are: Very Slow, Slow, Normal, Fast, Very Fast

SizeThe size of each slide is set here. Options are: Extra Small, Small, Medium Large, Extra Large, and Automatic.
When you select Automatic, the size will be determined automatically by the height that you have set on the dashboard.

DirectionLeft to Right, or Right to Left scrolling direction.
Note that this does not change the text to right-to-left reading order.
This option is ignored if you select Vertical orientation.
OrientationThis setting will align the visualization either horizontally or vertically.

Change CaseALL CAPS: Enforce ALL-CAPS for all text in the Value fields
No Change: Leave text as-is.

Color ModeBackground - fills in the background of the slides depending on the range field
Foreground - colors the text and border based on the range field.
Default CaptionIf no value is set for the caption field in the search, this value will be used. If left blank, no caption will display.
Show DotsThis setting will optionally display the navigation dots beneath the slides when in horizontal mode. Clicking the dots will navigate to the slides.
PrecisionSet the number of decimal places to display for numerical values. This is not applicable to text values.
Use Thousands SeparatorsFor numerical values, optionally add a comma after every group of 3 digits. E.g. will convert 123456789 to 123,456,789.
Default UnitIf no value is set fo the unit field in the search, this value will be used. If left blank, no unit will display.
Unit PositionWhere to place the unit (either from the search or the default unit). E.g. '$' is displayed before the value, where as '%' is displayed after.
